column4: hey, was just asking if with the new ubuntu 7.10 RC if they made it so ATI x1650 cards can support beryl without having to go into xgl? would love to figure out a way to have 3D acceleration running with my beryl cube. thx for the help
I sent you a pm, not sure if that's allowed here, sorry if it isn't.
didn't get it (you need to be registered)

anyway to go around it temporarily? was reading a tutorial where it would have two terminals in one, and bypass the xgl problem, but it load the game (was using neverball as an example) and would just crash after a little bit.
not sure about that, I've played with more than on xserver but not xgl/standard
out of curiosity (might want to play a game or two myself) what's the link you are using?
one sec, let me grab tutorial link, how do I messages directly to you that are in red? or does it just do that when you have "name:" first.
and your howto, I'd change that display=:93 to display=:0 , like blindside had :)
tried that and it still crashed the prog, :(
know any other display settings i can try?
that's an old howto, it may need updates.or have updates deeper in. Don't have the inclination to read it all right now, but I've bookmarked it for later
know any other display=:? that I can use, not too familiar with that command, so I'm not sure what it does.
